cyclone.name: OLGA
cyclone.current_location: about 320 miles SSW of Lake Charles, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northeast across the north-western Gulf toward the Louisiana coast, then inland through the Lower Mississippi Valley
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana coast (near the TX-LA border to southeast Louisiana)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: northern Gulf Coast from the TX/LA border eastward through Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with gusts generally below tropical-storm force expected; sustained tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely at the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Galveston Bay or the Houston Ship Channel due to the cyclone staying east of the area.
weather_observation.rainfall: Scattered outer rainbands may produce 1–2 inches of rain, locally higher, mainly late Friday through early Saturday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minimal coastal flooding possible at high tide and isolated brief tornadoes well east of the port; operational disruption risk is low.
